title: Every dating app has AI now. Can it help make better matches?
description: A new app called Known seeks an end to the swiping era by using artificial intelligence to play matchmaker.
content: In other words, there’s no swiping. Known, founded by former Stanford University students Celeste Amadon and Asher Allen, uses an AI-based chat interface that interviews prospective daters and gauges their interests and values. Then, the app uses a m... [2510 chars]

title: Cisco AI Summit 2026 brings the world’s most influential AI leaders together to define what comes next
description: The upcoming Cisco AI Summit on February 3, 2026, brings together global technology leaders to explore how artificial intelligence is shifting from experimental tools to core infrastructure. With a diverse lineup that includes executives from top tech firms, the summit will focus on real-world impact, the challenges of scaling AI, and the strategic decisions that will determine how businesses and society benefit from AI innovations.

title: Fratarcangeli Wealth Management on Portfolio Concentration Risk in an AI- and Tech-Driven Market
description: As artificial intelligence (AI) and large-cap technology stocks continue to dominate economic growth patterns and market headlines, the conversation around portfolio concentration risk has grown louder, and often more alarmist. But according to Jeffrey Fratarcangeli, founder and CEO of Fratarcangeli Wealth Management, the underlying principles haven’t changed, even if the speed of wealth creation has. […]
